page.title: 01Leiston and its environs.
page.content: ENERGY, ECOLOGY AND LOCAL HISTORY feature prominently in the story of LEISTON in l985. LEISTON (population 5000) CUM SIZEWELL is dominated by its nuclear power station standing on a 245 acre coastal site. This Suffolk Sandling Heathland is an important site for ECOLOGY and recreation. The Long Shop Museum preserves the heritage of the industrial past associated with the pioneering engineers,Richard Garrett and sons.The paternal influence of the company can still be felt in the public utilities, agricultural drainage and Leiston Housing. Safety Equipment and Micro light aircraft are amongst the products of LEISTON today.Leiston retains the appearance of an industrial town surrounded by farm and heath land.
